it.polimi.se2018.util

Class SafeSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.util.SafeSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InputStreamWaiterTest.TestSSocket, SocketCommLayerTest.SocTest, SocketInQueueFillerTest.TestSSocket, SocketServerTest.SocketMock

    public class SafeSocket
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A wrapper to Socket that ensures delivery and recognizes failures
    Author:
    Francesco Franzini

                  long timeout)
           throws java.io.IOException

        timeout - the timeout(in milliseconds) for this SafeSocket

      • connect

        public boolean connect(java.lang.String host,
                       int port)
        Connects to a host and begins to listen on the input stream
        Parameters:
        host - the hostname to connect to
        port - the port to use
        Returns:
        true if the connection was a success, false otherwise or if the socket was already used in a connection

        public boolean send(java.io.Serializable obj)
        Sends a serializable object through the active connection and blocks execution until an ack is received or the network times out
        Parameters:
        obj - the serializable object to send
        Returns:
        true if the ack is received

      • receive

        public java.io.Serializable receive()
                             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Reads one object from the input queue, if no object is available it blocks execution until it can return something
        Returns:
        a Serializable object received from the other end or null if an error occurred
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted
